verses.verse: (1 The increase of mankind by Noah and his sons.10 The beginning of cities, countries, and nations.) Now these are the (These generations are here recited, partly to declare the marvelous increase in so small a time, and also to set forth their great forgetfulness of God’s grace towards their fathers.) generations of the sons of Noah, Shem, Ham and Japheth: unto whom sons were born after the flood.
The sons of Japheth were Gomer, and Magog, and (Of Madai and Javan came the Medes, and Greeks.) Madai, and Javan, and Tubal, and Meshech, and Tiras.
And the sons of Gomer, Ashkenaz, and Riphath, and Togarmah.
Also the sons of Javan, Elishah and Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.

Of these were the (The Jews so call all countries which are separated from them by sea, as Greece, Italy, etc, which were given to the children of Japheth, of whom came the Gentiles.) isles of the Gentiles divided in their lands, every man after his tongue, and after their families in their nations.
¶ Moreover, the sons of Ham were (Of Cush and Mizraim came the Ethiopians and Egyptians.) Cush, and Mizraim, and Put, and Canaan.
And the sons of Cush, Seba and Havilah, and Sabtah, and Raamah, and Sabtechah: also the sons of Raamah were Sheba and Dedan.
And Cush begat Nimrod, who began to be (Meaning, a cruel oppressor and tyrant.) mighty in the earth.

He was a mighty hunter before the Lord. Wherefore it is said, (His tyranny came into a proverb as hated both of God and man: for he passed not to commit cruelty even in God’s presence.) As Nimrod the mighty hunter before the Lord.
And the beginning of his kingdom was Babel and Erech, and Accad, and Calneh, in the land of (For there was another city in Egypt, called also Babel.) Shinar.
Out of that land came Assyria, and built Nineveh, and the (Or, the streets of the city.) city Rehoboth, and Calah:
Resen also between Nineveh and Calah: this is a great city.
And Mizraim begat (Of Lud came the Lydians.) Ludim, and Anamim, and Lehabim, and Naphtuhim.
Pathrusim also, and Casluhim (out of whom came the Philistines) and (Or, the Cappadocians.) Caphtorims.
Also Canaan begat Sidon his firstborn, and Heth,
And Jebusi, and Emori, and Girgashi,
And Hivi, and Arki, and Sini,
And Arvadi, and Zemari, and Hamathi: and afterward were the families of the Canaanites spread abroad.
Then the border of the Canaanites was from Sidon, as thou comest to Gerar until Gaza, and as thou goest unto Sodom and Gomorrah, and Admah, and Zeboiim, even unto Lasha.
These are the sons of Ham according to their families, according to their tongues in their countries, and in their nations.

¶ Unto (In his stock the Church was preserved: therefore Moses leaveth off speaking of Japheth and Ham, and entreateth of Shem more at large.) Shem also the father of all the sons of (Of whom came the Hebrews or Jews.) Eber, and elder brother of Japheth were children born.
(Cross references: : 1 Chron. 1:17) The sons of Shem were Elam and Asshur, and Arphaxad, and Lud, and Aram.
And the sons of Aram, Uz and Hul, and Gether, and Mash.
Also Arphaxad begat Salah, and Salah begat Eber.

Unto Eber also were born two sons: the name of the one was Peleg: for in his days was the earth (This division came by the diversity of languages, as appeareth, Gen. 11:9.) divided: and his brother’s name was Joktan.
Then Joktan begat Almodad, and Sheleph, and Hazarmaveth, and Jerah,
And Hadoram, and Uzal, and Diklah,
And Obal, and Abimael, and Sheba,
And Ophir, and Havilah, and Jobab: all these were the sons of Joktan.
And their dwelling was from Mesha, as thou goest up to Sephar, a mount of the East.
These are the sons of Shem, according to their families, according to their tongues in their countries and nations.
These are the families of the sons of Noah, after their generations among their people: and (Or, of these came divers nations.) out of these were the nations divided in the earth after the flood.
